intro: Graffenrieda gracilis, commonly known as the slender graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
